page.title: 13N.TONBRIDGE FASHION:1950-70
page.content: In the 1950's,men's formal wear was still dinner-jackets or tails.The women wore long or Ballerina-length dresses.These were made of stiff materials like taffeta or wild silk. They wore with these,stiletto heels or "winkle-pickers",in very thin satin, dyed to match the dresses.For informal wear the "Teddy boys" wore drainpipe Jeans with greased-back hair.The women wore circular or double-circular skirts.Then came the 60's with men's formal wear remaining dinner-jackets and tails.The women still wore long dresses and,later on,long skirts and evening blouses.The men had "Bouffant" hairstyles,obtained by backcombing.For informal wear,the women wore mini- skirts,Bermuda shorts or pedal- pushers.The men wore cravates,cavalry twill trousers,suede shoes and long hair,often shoulder-length.
